perturbation.original_text:
During the term of this Agreement, LKPL will provide
                  Axiometric with a license to use office space in LKPL's
                  corporate facility in Columbia, Maryland, free of charge.
perturbation.changed_text:
During the term of this Agreement, the Company will provide
                  Axiometric with a license to use office space in the Company's
                  corporate facility in Columbia, Maryland, free of charge.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'LKPL' with 'the Company'. The contract doesn't explicitly define 'the Company,' creating ambiguity as to whether 'LKPL' and 'the Company' are the same entity. This could lead to confusion about which entity is responsible for providing the office space.

perturbation.original_text:
Axiometric must indemnify and hold LKPL and its officers,
                  directors, stockholders, agents, contractors, employees and
                  guests (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") harmless from
                  and against any and all Loss that the Indemnified Parties may
                  incur arising from or relating to Axiometric use of the office
                  space, including but not limited to any Loss suffered by the
                  Indemnified Parties as a result of any negligent acts or
                  omissions of Axiometric, its employees, agents, contractors
                  and representatives, or anyone else working under Axiometric
                  or in the office with the permission of Axiometric.
perturbation.changed_text:
Axiometric must indemnify and hold the Corporation and its officers,
                  directors, stockholders, agents, contractors, employees and
                  guests (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") harmless from
                  and against any and all Loss that the Indemnified Parties may
                  incur arising from or relating to Axiometric use of the office
                  space, including but not limited to any Loss suffered by the
                  Indemnified Parties as a result of any negligent acts or
                  omissions of Axiometric, its employees, agents, contractors
                  and representatives, or anyone else working under Axiometric
                  or in the office with the permission of Axiometric.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'LKPL' with 'the Corporation'. The contract doesn't explicitly define 'the Corporation,' creating ambiguity as to whether 'LKPL' and 'the Corporation' are the same entity, especially given that 'LKPL' is defined as 'Link Plus Corporation'. This could lead to disputes about who Axiometric is obligated to indemnify.
